learning_outcomes.description: Outline the theoretical foundations of workhorse econometric methods.
Apply econometric methods to real-world data and learn the correct way to report and interpret empirical results.
Choose and implement appropriate econometric techniques to conduct estimation, prediction, and statistical inference.
Examine the internal and external validities of econometric models applying to specific empirical problems.
Implement econometric analysis using software packages like R.

assessments.task_description: Analytical and data-based problems. This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Electronic submissions via Blackboard of a single PDF document with all relevant materials.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Part 1: Analytical problems (similar to Assignments 1-2).

Part 2: Empirical questions: Use R to conduct a (guided) mini empirical study or replicate the empirical/simulation results presented in a published journal article.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of Al technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Introduction and Math Review

course introduction, Matrix algebra, review of elementary probability and statistics

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Course Introduction and Math Review course introduction, Matrix algebra, review of elementary probability and statistics

learning_activities.topic:
Review of Multiple Regression and M-estimation

Review matrix treatment of multiple regression; Gauss-Markov Theorem and assumptions; conditional prediction; loss function; M-estimation; causal vs. non causal relations; examples.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Review of Multiple Regression and M-estimation Review matrix treatment of multiple regression; Gauss-Markov Theorem and assumptions; conditional prediction; loss function; M-estimation; causal vs. non causal relations; examples.

learning_activities.topic:
Maximum Likelihood Estimation

Basic likelihood concepts; score functions; computation of MLE; large sample properties; examples from univariate and regression models; likelihood-based inference.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Maximum Likelihood Estimation Basic likelihood concepts; score functions; computation of MLE; large sample properties; examples from univariate and regression models; likelihood-based inference.

learning_activities.topic:
GMM Basics and Extensions

Simultaneous equations framework. Essential GMM Motivation; the Analogy Principle; causal parameters; simultaneous equations; IV estimation; GMM extensions; large sample properties

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: GMM Basics and Extensions Simultaneous equations framework. Essential GMM Motivation; the Analogy Principle; causal parameters; simultaneous equations; IV estimation; GMM extensions; large sample properties

learning_activities.topic:
Linear Panel Data Models A

Advantages of panel data; basics of linear panel models; pooled, random effects and fixed effect models; target parameters and estimation by GLS; applications.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Linear Panel Data Models A Advantages of panel data; basics of linear panel models; pooled, random effects and fixed effect models; target parameters and estimation by GLS; applications.

learning_activities.topic:
Linear Panel Data Models B

Extensions of basic models; types of exogeneity; endogenous regressors; dynamic models; GMM methods; application to MABEL data.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Linear Panel Data Models B Extensions of basic models; types of exogeneity; endogenous regressors; dynamic models; GMM methods; application to MABEL data.

learning_activities.topic:
Simulation-based Estimation and Inference

Computer-intensive methods for estimation and inference; simulation-based MLE and GMM; bootstrap standard errors; applications to panel models.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Simulation-based Estimation and Inference Computer-intensive methods for estimation and inference; simulation-based MLE and GMM; bootstrap standard errors; applications to panel models.

learning_activities.topic:
Quantile Regression

Conditional quantiles (CQ); semiparametric models; marginal quantiles; MAD and CQ estimation; advantages of non separable heterogeneous responses; treatment effects.

18 April is a public holiday. No class, tutorial, or consultation session will be held that day.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Quantile Regression Conditional quantiles (CQ); semiparametric models; marginal quantiles; MAD and CQ estimation; advantages of non separable heterogeneous responses; treatment effects. 18 April is a public holiday. No class, tutorial, or consultation session will be held that day.

Key concepts related to hypothesis tests, Wald, criterion-based, and score tests.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05

Kernel density and regression; mixture models; kernel regression; mixture of normals; inference on mixture models

learning_activities.topic:
Big Data and Machine Learning

High dimensional regression; Ridge regression; LASSO; penalty variable selection; LASSO IV; double/debiased machine learning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
